p: Such engagement from the health sector should be met with increased recognition from the main climate change funding bodies, which do not currently focus on health nor stipulate proportions of funding for health [ 13]. Commitments to these funding mechanisms have increased in recent years; for example, the Green Climate Fund is aiming to mobilise USD 100 billion by 2050 and already has USD 10.3 billion at its disposal [ 35, 36]. Such progress presents huge opportunities for public health practice to obtain funding for climate change adaptation and to mainstream such actions into existing health practices.
